definition: to avoid a taboo word or topic
to avoid a taboo word or topic/to refrain from/to avoid
to avoid/to shun/to flee/to escape/to keep away from/to leave/to hide from
to avoid mentioning/taboo word/name of deceased emperor or superior

sentences.english: I confess, gestational surrogacy is a topic that I have steered clear of until now.
sentences.chinese: 老實說，代孕的話題到現在都令我避諱。

sentences.english: For I have not shunned to declare unto you all the counsel of God.
sentences.chinese: 因爲神的旨意，我並沒有一樣避諱不傳給你們的。

sentences.english: And labour-market reforms are not all that he is shying away from.
sentences.chinese: 他也不那麼避諱談及勞動力市場的改革。

sentences.english: A man should taboo bad hobbies, and cultivate good habits.
sentences.chinese: 作爲男人應該避諱不良嗜好，培養良好的習慣。

sentences.english: In the weeks following childbirth, women should not avoid any nutritious foods.
sentences.chinese: 分娩之後的幾周，婦女不該避諱有營養的食物。

sentences.english: However that Guo's surname is four elder brothers' persons, three sisters-in-law still a forbid are some is good.
sentences.chinese: 不過那郭氏可是四哥的人，三嫂還是避諱一些爲好。

sentences.english: Japan's ancient myth, no taboo on sex.
sentences.chinese: 日本的古代神話，對性就毫不避諱。

sentences.english: But the Chinese don't even pretend this is the case.
sentences.chinese: 但是中國人甚至不避諱承認這就是事實。

definition: taboo name (e.g. of emperor)
to add parallels and interpretations (to a story etc)/to develop and embellish/to interpret (often in a strained manner)

History of the Early Tang Dynasty, sixteenth of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], compiled under Liu Xu 劉昫|刘昫[Liu2 Xu4] in 945 during Later Jin 後晉|后晋[Hou4 Jin4] of the Five Dynasties, 200 scrolls
to copy (a text) from person to person/(of a text) to be transmitted by copying

History of the Later Tang Dynasty, seventeenth of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], compiled under Ouyang Xiu 歐陽修|欧阳修[Ou1 yang2 Xiu1] and Song Qi 宋祁[Song4 Qi2] in 1060 during Northern Song 北宋[Bei3 Song4], 225 scrolls
Tao Zongyi (c. 1329-1410), Yuan dynasty scholar
variant character/loan word/variant written form (for the same word)/different edition
meaning of a character
essay on policy in question and answer form used in imperial exams
to spread falsehoods/to increasingly distort the truth/to pile errors on top of errors (idiom)
to mark a text with dots and circles/to punctuate
imperial edict
to overcorrect (idiom)/to overcompensate

History of Eastern Han (later Han), third of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], composed by Fan Ye 范曄|范晔[Fan4 Ye4] in 445 during Song of the Southern Dynasties 南朝宋[Nan2 chao2 Song4], 120 scrolls
pausing at the end of a phrase or sentence (in former times, before punctuation marks were used)/punctuation/periods and commas/sentences and phrases
to check and correct
